title: X Factor: Celebrity: Martin Bashir admits singing is scarier than interviewing Princess Diana
text:
He's taking to the stage in front of a vast crowd on Saturday for the first live show.

And despite interviewing some of the world's biggest stars, X Factor: Celebrity star Martin Bashir has admitted he found performing for Simon Cowell even scarier than conducting his interview with Princess Diana.

Speaking to Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford on Thursday's This Morning, the broadcaster, 56, said that while he's spent several weeks preparing for the performance he's still fraught with nerves.

Scroll down for video

Nervous: X Factor: Celebrity star Martin Bashir has admitted he finds the idea of performing in the live shows scarier than interviewing Princess Diana (pictured during his audition)

As Eamonn noted that Martin had worked on live television for years and conducted some of the most high profile interviews in history, the journalist admitted he's still unprepared for his first live X Factor performance on Saturday.

He said: 'I've been a journalist for 36 years, we do that, we broadcast live, not a problem. I've been a vocalist for four weeks and on Saturday I'm going from nothing to an audience of millions and alive audience so it's not easy.'

Noting his 1995 interview with Diana, Martin added: 'I didn't conduct that interview in front of anyone apart from a cameraman, a sound recordist and a producer.

'There are going to be over 400 people in the studio, I have to remember lighting cues, cam movements, I have to make certain moves.'

Dramatic: The legendary broadcaster famously interview the Princess in 1995 for Panorama, and the eye-opening chat has gone down in TV history

Candid: Martin was a guest on Thursday's This Morning to chat about his upcoming performance

Open: The broadcaster said: 'I've been a vocalist for four weeks and on Saturday I'm going from nothing to an audience of millions and alive audience so it's not easy'

Martin was tight-lipped about his song choice for Saturday's show but did hint that it's a popular song from several major movies.

He said: 'We've been helped by out vocal coaches and they enabled me to focus more on the pitch and rhythm and performance.

'It's a demanding process, the coaching has been incredible, but if I do badly it will be entirely down to myself. I think you will recognise the piece because it's been used in several well-known movies.

'I will be helped on-stage by a large number of people. When you see the performance it will be uplifting even if I don't do so great.'

Amazing: Martin will take to the stage on Saturday alongside the rest of the Overs category, which has been mentored by Nicole Scherzinger

Martin had previously revealed that he decided to sign up for X Factor: Celebrity as a tribute to his late brother Tommy.

He told Eamonn and Ruth: 'As we get older we close ourselves down, we become more anxious more fearful, I'll be making fewer friends.

'This has forced me to do something that I would never in a million years have dreamt of doing. It shows that regardless of your age you can learn a new skill.'

Martin will take to the stage on Saturday alongside fellow Overs Jenny Ryan, Vinnie Jones, Ricki Lake and Victoria Ekanoye, after weeks of practice and mentoring by Nicole Scherzinger.

X Factor: Celebrity airs on Saturday at 8:20pm on ITV. This Morning airs weekdays at 10:30am on ITV.
description: The broadcaster, 56, said on Thursday's This Morning that even after weeks of preparations he's still more nervous than during his famous interview with Diana in 1995.
